title: Just won a game easily based off the fact that my entire team was postive and coordinated.
body:
Hint-Hint, guys.

Teamwork, communication, and positiveness (if thats a word) wins games. Not "who carried the most" or "which lanes won."

replies.body: Maybe your team was positive and coordinated cause you guys were winning.....Iv seen plenty of team turn to a shit storm once we started losing but, was nice before.
Yeah people are happy to be chill when youre 4/0 but as soon as you get shut down suddenly youre basically hitler

And maybe they were winning because they were positive and coordinated?

It seems like a cause/effect loop rather than a cause-and-effect linear correlation, from what I've seen. However, since being positive is an active *choice* (you can't always win, period) even in the face of emotional adversity, you have more agency in that regard.

I just won 7 matches with 2 losses in between, had to honor all players on my team for the reason this post is made. Load screen tip even says you win 16%(or something) more games without bad behavior in games.

Sometimes though, if both teams are well coordinated it could be asking for disaster.
One team is bound to lose, and as soon that team begins losing the lead, everything starts to fall apart.

"gl hf" turns into "wtf Annie you braindead cuck uninstall and fucking kill yourself. autistic braindead just remove yourself from gene pool"
A team that was once using pings "Lucian is on the way" would now begin to spam them "?Lucian?signals?an?enemy?is?missing?"

I've had a Heimerdinger top who began the pre-game chat with "hi" "i'm heimerdinger" and said it again at the beginning of the game. I thought he was friendly, but as soon as I died twice in a row, he began harassing me constantly throughout the game. Every SINGLE minute he would belittle me and spam ???????. "why are you inting" he said. I responded "i'm not, I know I'm doing very bad and I'm sorry. i just got beat and got caught. but im trying my best"
"[all] report ryze he lost us the game and is inting" "[all] i'm not inting"
Enemy responds that they'll report us both.

I've only scraped the surface of what Heimer said. He was relentless, going after me without pause. Pinging me whenever he could. I also don't know how he could type so much. I could hardly respond back to him, because i was busy trying not to die again. Heimer was the type of guy who calls you "kid", like he was a grown man playing League. Though I'm guessing he's probably in high school or college.
Teamwork OP. Plz nerf kappa
this happens so rarely that you actually made a post about it

https://i.giphy.com/3o85xCuIEkuBatcUjm.gif

Nice one.
To win a game you need to make decision and call for objective and use ping .

Lies. 

In order to me to win again in League I most become a carry lord. 

In order to do so I must cheese the enemy, if anyone only my team does they get insta flames and MIA ping spam because you know.. one mistake causes you the game. 

The jungler should also camp my lane exclusively, he should stop wasting time killing camps, really is a waste of time he should do something more productive. 

Lastly I I don't go 20/0 and carry I flame my team to let them know they're trash and insta report and also blame the jungler if he didn't camp. 

THIS, is how you win a game of League.

>This completely biased, anecdotal evidence is a proof I am right.

FTFY

You're goddamn right. 
I swear man, after the first 3 kills the chat turns into WW3, and only gets worse from there. /mute all ftw.
Just from the title I thought it would be in M&G
It sure aspired to be one of those threads making fun of loading "tips".
why do we care?

Because when people act the opposite of this post, it makes elo hell real. Only reason people say its not real is because most of the time they're the trolls flaming and you don't seem to have the best attitude either considering you don't care about these facts.

Facts? Oh boy.

It's easy to be positive when you are winning. It actually takes effort to not be positive while winning.
What does take effort is being positive while losing.

In the first case positivity has no impact on the outcome of the game, because you already won it in terms of ability to play the game.
In the second case you are praying enemies get too positive and make mistakes.
I respek this reply. It all makes sense, but I'm thinking I may be missing out on the point you're trying to make :/

My point is that saying "being positive wins games" is a biased, one-sided statement.

Positivity helps, yes, but it's secondary to being superior than the enemy.
Winning makes you happy and it's easy to stay happy when you are winning.

---

Well, now that I read your initial comment like 3 times, I realized you were talking about the perception of ELO hell the entire time.
Just in time for ping muting
